#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Communicate Better and Not Argue
#Text=Everybody argues once in a while , but for some people to stop is a lot harder than others .
#Text=Teenagers especially tend to argue a lot with their family .
#Text=Hopefully this article will help to stop it .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Discover the key things that tick you off .
#Text=If there are a few specific issues that make you angry , find a way to discuss these with your family .
#Text=Do not do this forcefully , but instead calmly , saying why it is that it frustrates you .
#Text=Let your family have their input also , and find a way to avoid these situations that make you so annoyed .
#Text=Try to spend more time with the person that you argue most with ; whether it be sibling or parent .
#Text=At first this may be hard , and you may find yourself at first having even more arguments due to the increased amount of time you are spending with them .

#Text=However , perseverance will definitely pay off ; you will learn what you have in common with this person and develop a stronger bond with them that allows you to avoid arguments , or if they arise , to sort them out effectively .
#Text=Take a deep breath .
#Text=When somebody says something and you feel the burst of anger inside , take a deep breath and look downwards .
#Text=Count to ten , calmly ignoring them .
#Text=Then answer what they have said collectively without rudeness .
#Text=Change the topic craftily if possible !
#Text=This will take time - but it is something that once learnt , will always help you .
#Text=Walk out .
#Text=If an argument is getting out of hand or you cannot seem to master the breathing technique , walk out of the room .
#Text=Your family may find this rude so make sure to explain before or afterward about why you are doing this .
#Text=If you have walked out , or the issue is nagging you , think of a way to discuss it with your family , once both of you are calm .
#Text=Say what happened in your perspective and do n't make it long .
#Text=Do n't be aggressive .
#Text=If they interrupt , try not to flare up , just continue calmly .
#Text=Listen to what they have to say and keep in mind that they probably felt similar to you .
#Text=Neither of you are probably completely right .
#Text=Then apologise .
#Text=If they approach you first , listen , listen , listen .
#Text=Apologize .
#Text=If arguments do happen , it is NOT weak to be the first to apologize .
#Text=In fact , this is one of the hardest things to do .
#Text=Apologizing , if you do it properly without the whole ' ( glare ) " sorry " ( walk out of the room ) ' thing , will help you to get things into perspective .
#Text=You may realize your mistakes and hopefully , this will prevent them in the future .
#Text=You may also find that when apologizing , the other person will respect you for this and admit what they have done wrong also .
#Text=Make sure you have cooled down before apologizing as well !
#Text=Otherwise , the whole thing might start all over again .
#Text=Never give up .
#Text=Do not try to do everything at once and just take it step by step .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=Do not feel under pressure to solve this immediately - you are not the only one and in time , you will be able to see a change .
#Text=Keep trying
#Text=Respect everybody in your family for who they are
#Text=Remember your family loves you
